value.title: Meta’s New AI Bot Says “Mark Zuckerberg’s Practices Are Not Always Ethical”
value.excerpt: Meta’s new AI bot said that chief Mark Zuckerberg’s “practices are not always ethical”. Furthermore, it also said that the founder of Facebook can be “creepy and controlling”. BlenderBot 3, a chatbot which is powered by artificial intelligence,

value.title: AI Ethics Asks Whether It Makes Any Sense To Ask AI If AI Itself Is Sentient
value.excerpt: AI Ethics raises the thorny question as to whether the question asked of AI about AI itself being sentient is a bit overrated, including frowning at recent headlines boldly and falsely proclaiming sentient AI existence.

value.title: AI is not sentient. Why do people say it is?
value.excerpt: The problem is that the people closest to the technology — the people explaining it to the public — live with one foot in the future. They sometimes see what they believe will happen as much as they s

value.title: Ethical AI and biometrics move forward. More industry, academia effort needed
value.excerpt: The road toward ethical, inclusive AI is still long, fortunately, new generations are being provided with the tools to help research move in this direction.

value.title: What Tech Leaders Should Consider About The Ethical Use Of AI In The Metaverse
value.excerpt: With the advent of the metaverse which utilizes AI-based technology, ethical use will become an important point of concern for both brands and users.

value.title: ITRI Hosts 2022 International Workshop on Trustworthy AI to Discuss Trust and Ethics in AI
value.excerpt: With the support of the Industrial Development Bureau (IDB) under the Minister of Economic Affairs, ITRI held the 2022 International Workshop on Trustworthy AI online on August 2. Over 400 experts gathered at the first-ever conference in Taiwan on this theme to discuss topics such as AI risk management and trustworthy AI systems.

value.title: AI can revolutionise medical research, but a cautious approach is needed
value.excerpt: One week social-media users are generating and sharing amusing images using AI, the next we hear AI can predict the structure of over 200 million proteins.

value.title: DeepMind's Perceiver AR: a step toward more AI efficiency
value.excerpt: The auto-regressive attention at the heart of the Transformer, and programs like it, becomes a scaling nightmare. A recent DeepMind/Google work proposes a way to put such programs on a diet.

value.title: Why Corporate Purpose And AI Ethics Must Be A Leadership And Risk Management Priority (Blog 5 Of 5)
value.excerpt: This is the final blog in a 5 part blog series looking at corporate purpose, AI, ML and data management foundations. Practical questions are identified to guide board directors and CEOs to improve their governance leadership practices regarding AI/ML.

value.title: Why Corporate Purpose And AI Ethics Must be A Leadership And Risk Management Priority (Blog 4 Of 5)
value.excerpt: This blog series looks at the meaning of corporate purpose, the importance of AI Ethics, and evolving audit practices internally and externally to improve risk management practices, and advance digital literacy foundations.

value.title: AI Ethics Confronting Whether Humans Who Mistreat AI Are Alarmingly Immoral
value.excerpt: Consider the AI ethics of humans that mistreat AI, including people that lash out at AI-based self-driving cars.

value.title: Sony AI Wins 2022 ACM SIGAI Industry Award for Excellence in Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Company recognized for its recent AI breakthrough, Gran Turismo Sophy™, at the 31st Annual International Joint Conference on Artificial

value.title: Google fires Blake Lemoine, the engineer who claimed AI chatbot is a person
value.excerpt: Google has fired Blake Lemoine, the software engineer who was previously put on paid leave after claiming the company's LaMDA chatbot is sentient. Google said Lemoine, who worked in the company's Responsible AI unit,

value.title: Google fires engineer who contended its AI technology was sentient
value.excerpt: By Ramishah Maruf, CNN Google has fired the engineer who claimed an unreleased AI system had become sentient, the company confirmed, saying he violated employment and data security policies. Blake Lemoine,

value.title: AI Ethics Struggling With The Fiery One-Two Punch Of Both AI-Based Autonomous Weapons Systems And The Exploitation...
value.excerpt: AI Ethics dealing with autonomous weapons systems along with autonomous systems that perchance are later weaponized. It's a worldwide and quite sobering concern.

value.title: Is It Ethical To Use Robots In War? What Are The Risks Associated With It?
value.excerpt: The use of robots in combat has always raised the ‘ethics’ question. This post tries to answer it by taking a detailed look at the pros and cons of using robots in wars.

value.title: Google fires engineer who contended its AI technology was sentient
value.excerpt: Google has fired an engineer who claimed an unreleased AI system had become sentient, the company confirmed, saying he violated employment and data security policies.

value.title: Ethical GmbH Adds Artificial Intelligence to SAE Data Reconciliation Automation
value.excerpt: By adding artificial intelligence (AI) to its eReconciliation® automation engine, Ethical helps to improve the automated matching accuracy and reduces even further time spent reviewing unmatched SAEs.

value.title: Don’t get too emotional about emotion-reading AI
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence tools now try to figure out whether people are happy, sad or disgusted. The reality may surprise and anger you.

value.title: Prosegur Security Launches World's First Responsible Artificial Intelligence Framework Globally
value.excerpt: An industry first, the Responsible AI Policy sets lawful, ethical and robust compliance for employees and partners utilizing Prosegur's AI

value.title: AI-generated faces are taking over the internet
value.excerpt: When Google fired an AI ethics researcher, Timnit Gebru, in 2020 for publishing a paper that highlighted bias in the company’s algorithms, a network of bots with AI-generated faces, who claimed ...

Register today! SAN FRANCISCO – VentureBeat is proud to announces the winners of the 4 th Women in AI Awards and its 4th AI Innovation Awards.

value.title: The Future of Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Even apart from the enduring dream of human-like intelligence, the future of AI is expected to play a deeply significant role in consumer and business markets.

value.title: The time is nigh for responsible AI and data ethics
value.excerpt: Many jurisdictions are following the EU’s proposed regulation of artificial intelligence. Firms that have not begun to develop their AI systems to comply with the new regulation are being advised to do so now.

value.title: Why Corporate Purpose And AI Ethics Must Be a Leadership And Risk Management Priority
value.excerpt: In today’s challenging world, there is an imperative to advance Corporate Purpose leadership at all levels of an organization. AI Ethics and Happiness Foundations must be integrated into Corporate Purpose.

value.title: AI Ethics Cautiously Assessing Whether Offering AI Biases Hunting Bounties To Catch And Nab Ethically Wicked Fully...
value.excerpt: The latest in AI Ethics consists of AI bias bounty hunting, though this raises a lot of questions, including as considered for aiming at AI-based self-driving cars.

value.title: U of G receives $1M donation to launch ethical AI training modules
value.excerpt: TD Bank Group has announced a C$1 million donation to the University of Guelph’s Centre for Advancing Responsible and Ethical Artificial Intelligence or CARE-AI. The funds, which will be paid out over a five-year period,

value.title: Government launches Defence Centre for AI Research
value.excerpt: The MoD and Alan Turing Institute announce the project as part of a wider plan to make the UK a world-leader in AI research

value.title: UAE: First BA Philosophy and Ethics programme in Arab region launched
value.excerpt: Mohamed Bin Zayed University for Humanities has launched a Bachelor of Arts in Philosophy and Ethics degree programme under the College of Arts and Humanities, the first academic offering of its kind in the region.
